Basics

{% raw %}

identity[source]

identity(x:T)

Indentity function.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

simplify[source]

simplify(x)

Return an object of an iterable if it is lonely.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The simplify function is used to de-nest an iterable with a single element in it, as for instance [1], while leaving everything else constant. It can also exchange a function for its default argument.

{% raw %} 
simplify({1})

1
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
simplify(simplify)(lambda x='lul': 2*x)

'omegalul'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

listify[source]

listify(x, *args)

Convert x to a list.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

What's very convenient is that it leaves lists invariant (it doen't nest them into a new list).

{% raw %} 
listify([1, 2])

[1, 2]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
listify(1, 2, 3)

[1, 2, 3]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

setify[source]

setify(x, *args)

Convert x to a set.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
setify(1, 2, 3)

{1, 2, 3}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

tuplify[source]

tuplify(x, *args)

Convert x to a tuple.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
tuplify(1)

(1,)
{% endraw %}

File manipulation helper

{% raw %}

get_files[source]

get_files(path, extensions=None, recurse=False, folders=None, followlinks=True)

Get all the files in path.

With optional extensions selection, optionally with recurse, only in folders, if specified.

Parameters

path: path-like indicates the place to search for files. extensions: str, list-like, optional if specified, return only files with specified extensions. recurse: bool, default=True if set to True, return files also present in subfolders recursively. folders: path-like, list-like, optional if specified, return only files within folders. followlinks: bool, default=True if set to True, will

Returns

list-like collection of filenames present at path with extensions.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}
